title: Farm Machine Safety: Fueling and Daily Maintenance Safety

tasks.task: Check and follow operator's manual safety practices for fueling and daily maintenance of tractors and farm equipment.
subtasks: Familiarize with symbols and colors indicating danger on equipment.
Remember that red signifies danger leading to death, orange to serious injury or death, and yellow to minor/mild injury.
Read all safety decals on the machine before starting any operations.
Follow instructions from the operator's manual when conducting any maintenance, refueling, or operations.
Keep a first aid kit in each tractor or self-propelled machine.
Daily check fluids as per operator's manual and follow safety procedures.
Refuel tractors only when engine is cool and off; never smoke during refueling.
Be cautious while climbing ladders to fuel tanks; check for wetness or ice.
Avoid overfilling fuel tanks and clean up any spills immediately.

tasks.task: Ensure proper tire pressure on tractors and farm equipment.
subtasks: Check tire pressure according to manufacturer's recommendations.
Inspect tires for cuts, cracks, or bruises.

tasks.task: Maintain proper vehicle visibility on public roads.
subtasks: Ensure two forward-facing headlights and a red tail light, both visible from 500 feet.
Install hazard warning lights or flashers when operating on public roads.
Keep clear windows and clean mirrors for good visibility.

tasks.task: Securely fasten and check engine shields for good condition.
subtasks: Ensure all lights (headlights, flashers, brake lights) are working correctly.
